factory_default.title: Glove80 Factory Default Layout
factory_default.notes: Glove80 Factory Layout has an extra factory layer (layer 3) for factory testing. The factory test layer makes it easy to test every key switch. Please note that there is no way to switch from the factory layer. You will need to power off and on the Glove80 to return to the base layer.

factory_default_macos.title: Glove80 Factory Default Layout for macOS
factory_default_macos.notes:
This is the Glove80 factory layout modified for macOS, with the Cmd and Ctrl keys swapped to accommodate macOS shortcuts.

Glove80 Factory Layout has an extra factory layer (layer 3) for factory testing. The factory test layer makes it easy to test every key switch. Please note that there is no way to switch from the factory layer. You will need to power off and on the Glove80 to return to the base layer.

mouse_emulation.title: Mouse Emulation Example
mouse_emulation.notes:
🖱️  Mouse Emulation Example (using Layout Editor’s built-in capabilities)
This example showcases Mouse Emulation Behaviors — including cursor movement, scrolling, and mouse button presses — powered by the Layout Editor’s built-in (native) Behaviors and Input Listeners.

✅ Enable HID_POINTING in Advanced Configuration

✅ First-time users clear all Bluetooth profiles and re-pair with their devices.

This example draws from Glorious Engrammer / TailorKey.
We’d like to acknowledge Sunaku and Moosy for their support and contributions to the Glove80 community.

🔍 For more details, please visit:
https://zmk.dev/docs/keymaps/behaviors/mouse-emulation
📝 Glove80 firmware version 25.05 or later is required.

kinesis.title: Kinesis Advantage-like Layout
kinesis.notes:
This layout is modelled after Kinesis Advantage2/Advantage360 layout, to help Advantage keyboard users transition to Glove80.

As you get used to Glove80, we strongly recommend you to experiment with different layouts and to take advantage of the more accessible Glove80 thumb clusters.
